required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: To Evaluate the Role of Lung Ultrasonography for Detection of Atlelectasis in Robot Assisted Laproscopic Pelvic Sugeries
clinical_study.official_title: TO EVALUATE THE ROLE OF LUNG ULTRASONOGRAPHY FOR DETECTION OF ATELECTASIS IN ADULTS UNDERGOING ROBOT ASSISTED LAPAROSCOPIC PELVIC SURGERIES

lead_sponsor.agency: Postgraduate Institute of Medical Education and Research

clinical_study.source: Postgraduate Institute of Medical Education and Research

brief_summary.textblock: Pre op ultrasound with chest auscultation and arterial blood gas, after extubation ultrasound with chest auscultation and blood gas, 12hrs chest auscultation with ultasaound, 24 hrs chest auscultation and ultrasound to see atelectasis

detailed_description.textblock:
Pre op ultrasound with chest auscultation and arterial blood gas, after extubation ultrasound with chest auscultation and blood gas, 12hrs chest auscultation with ultasaound, 24 hrs chest auscultation and ultrasound to see atelectasis inclusion criteria: age 18 to 70 yrs age ASA I and II robot assisted pelvic surgeries in steep trendelenburg position
exclusion criteria: cardiac disese severe obstructive and restrictive disease upper airways infection ASAIII and IV

primary_outcome.description: incidence of atelectasis in adults after extubation undergoing robot assisted pelvic laproscopic surgery in steep trendelenberg position using ultrasound

secondary_outcome.description: risk factor identification of post operative atelectasis

clinical_study.condition: to Detect the Incidence of Atelectasis

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- ASA Iand II age 18-70 yrs robot assisted pelvis surgeries
Exclusion Criteria:
- ASA II and IV cardiac and lung disease

overall_official.affiliation: Postgraduate Institute of Medical Education and Research

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Postgraduate Institute of Medical Education and Research
